description: Specify the orientation tracking state. Orientation tracking applies to PFC entities (clumps and walls). When enabled, the orientation of objects is tracked during rotation, allowing access to Euler angles and orientation-based attributes.
notes: Applies to PFC entities: clumps and walls
When enabled: orientation of objects is tracked during rotation
Allows access to Euler angles (euler-x, euler-y, euler-z in 3D)
Must be enabled BEFORE rotating objects if Euler angles are needed
Adds computational overhead - only enable if orientation information is required
Related clump attributes (require orientation tracking enabled):
Orientation tracking state persists until changed or model new

examples.description: Enable orientation tracking for clumps and walls

examples.command:
model orientation-tracking on
clump replicate name 'rock1' position (0,0,0)
clump rotate axis (0,0,1) angle 45 range id 1
clump list euler
examples.description: Enable tracking, create and rotate clump, then list Euler angles

examples.command:
model orientation-tracking on
model domain extent -10 10
clump generate number 100 radius 0.5
model cycle 1000
clump list euler range id 1 10
examples.description: Enable tracking before generating clumps to track orientation during cycling

examples.command:
model orientation-tracking on
; ... create and rotate objects ...
fish define check_rotation
  local euler_z = clump.euler.z(clump.find(1))
  io.out('Clump 1 rotation about z: ' + string(euler_z))
end
check_rotation
examples.description: Enable tracking to access Euler angles in FISH

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('model orientation-tracking on') or itasca.command('model orientation-tracking off') - Python SDK does not provide direct orientation tracking control
